oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from William Howard Bond to his family
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pvt. William Howard Bond, of Williamson County, wrote this letter to his family in Thompson Station, Tennessee. He talks of being sick but taking medicine and feeling better. He also discusses the weather and asks about those at home. At the time of the writing he was in camp at Camp Mills, Long Island, New York and serving in Co. I, 152nd Inf. Regt., 38th Div. He served overseas from October 1918 to July 1919. Toward the end of his service he was assigned the 52nd Guard Co.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
